reviews.text: The Westin is a typical 5 star Hotel- nothing special and starting to show signs of wear. The good things- great bathroom, large and stylish; comfortable bed; nice amenties and good central location.
reviews.title: Ho Hum
First Class All The Way
reviews.text: The hotel is in a beautiful heritage building, but is decorated in a bland modern style- go figure. No character at all. You could be anywhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bad things- hideously over priced room service; off-hand service.
reviews.title: Parking Nightmare

reviews.text: I guess what really turned me off this hotel was the incredibly dismissive "service" of staff, both at check-in and the congierge. I had booked with a discounted web site and feel that I was treated less because of it. I would expect much more from a 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel, very nice
Nice stay with my SPG points

reviews.text: The Westin Sydney is without a doubt the best Westin I've stayed in, far surpassing the dozen or so North Amercian Westin's I've stayed at. The rooms are well appointed, very clean, with great amenities, the staff are friendly, and the hotel building is great. If you are in town for business, this is in the heart of the Central Business District and a 5 minute walk from one of the main train stations. Definitely what I would recommend to business travellers and others wanting the experience of downtown Sydney. Great gym. The only draw back is tthat cost of the internet is high .. $120 for the week.
reviews.title: Amazing rooms, great location, friendly staff

reviews.text: I stayed 2 nights in early sept 2009 on a business trip. The hotel is fantastic. I stayed in a standard room and it was very luxurious with a great marble bathroom with large deep tub, a shower with a shower head the size of a dinner plate coming down from the ceiling and plenty of space. The room had everything you could want with large plasma tv, extremely comfy king size bed, working desk, internet connection etc.
reviews.title: Fantastic all round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel position was great. In Martin place, the centre of the CBD, with high class shops all around it and only a short walk to darling harbour, the rocks etc. We walked to both during the trip and it was only 10 min walk to both.
reviews.title: Indulgent and quiet weekender in the heart of sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Couldn't have been happier with my stay and would highly recommend. I stayed on a 2 night deal at $245 a night with $100 food and beverage credit thron in booked directly on their website. The credit doesn't go far with bfast $42 a head and the bar prices very steep but probably expected of a hotel of this class.
reviews.title: Fun and luxurious, if the heart of the CBD is your style

reviews.text: Sydney is a great place for out-of-towners to spend a weekend - and the Westin on Martin Place is a fantastic way to do it.
reviews.title: A real class act

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Westin in Sydney several times and never been disappointed.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.text: The hotel is impeccable clean and well maintained, the rooms are modern, equipped with all the amenities, have comfortable beds and great bathrooms. The room service is nice but quite pricey.
reviews.title: Good Location
Loved the Westin
reviews.text: The hotels heritage rooms are also lovely but I prefer the tower rooms as I like to stay on a high floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel's restaurant is delicious and the restaurants and bars at GPO (located within the hotel) are fantastic. The only downside is the hotel lobby, restaurants and GPO (the parts that are open) are very quite and dead on the weekend.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings at the Westin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location, close to public transport, main CBD shopping areas and walking distance to many tourist attractions.
reviews.title: One of our favourites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed for one night, so didn't get to experience a whole lot of the Westin and can't say a whole lot about it.
reviews.title: Modern

likes.disliked: — Noise from the street, lack of intimacy in public areas (lobby, restaurants etc)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We actually chose to stay in the heritage (rather than tower) section of the hotel, which is older, and the hallways almost had a dormitory feel to them, so would probably go for a tower room if we happened to stay again (unlikely though! mainly due to lack of an intimate feel to the hotel, which we prefer, so would probably choose a hyatt or sheraton next time).
reviews.title: Loved the Westin

reviews.text: The heritage superior king room was quite spacious, HUGE ceilings which were a lovely unique feature, a lot of closet space, modern bathrooms and all the comforts you need.
reviews.title: Great Service, Location, & Price

reviews.text: On the down side, our room was on a low level so being a Saturday night it was extremely noisy on the street until all hours.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, overpriced ammenities

reviews.text: Breakfast was amazing, it was part of our package (where we also got champage and chocolates - a great deal off wotif!).
reviews.title: Probably the best place to stay in Sydney overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel. I had a one bedroom suite was very modern clean we came back 3 times throughout the holiday as like it so much. The club lounge and staff were very good only problem was the food in the club lounge not like in America and Dubai cheese every night could have been more. Would stay here for sure again if go to Australia..
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: I have enjoyed the Starwood hotels (to which the Westin is one of) all over the world and was excited to see what the Sydney Westin had to offer. I am disappointed to review that my stay The Westin in Sydney was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had.
reviews.title: Never again
Excellent in every area
reviews.text: A bell boy who shut my pressed suit in the door and a very grumpy check-in host were just the start. This was followed by dirt and sand in my (presumably) un-used bed and hair sticking out of the drain, follow this with a constantly running toilet (that for some reason no one could manage to fix for three days) and this hotel felt more like a thatched bungalow in the Thailand jungle.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do yourself a favour and stay at one of the many other world class hotels Sydney has to offer, The Westin is not worth the money!
reviews.title: Consistently excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights in late May and had an excellent stay. Our first three nights were in an Executive Suite which was absolutely fantastic. The room had a good sized lounge, separate toilet off the enterance and a large main bathroon with a great view over the city. This room also included access to the Club lounge on the 28th floor. We had drinks here each evening along with canapes and a cheese selection. The breakfast in the lounge each morning was the best I have had in an executive club. It included a huge range of fresh fruits, pastries, cereals, espresso coffee and four decent hot selections. Everything was super fresh and well presented. The service in the lounge was great both in the morning and evenings. On the second night in the club lounge the waitress remembered my drink preference from the previous night.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Westin for one night in April. The location of the hotel can't be beaten, but it is a bit hard to find the entrance to the hotel as the web site says the entrance is on another street. The rooms were large and well equiped and the bathroom is one of the largest we have seen for a while. We didn't eat in the hotel, as we chose to eat from one of the many cafes that are in the surrounding streets.
reviews.title: Ok but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are only two downsides - 1. parking if you park your car yourself be ready for a long windy walk but up to the hotel lobby.
reviews.title: Difficult to fault

reviews.text: 2. Make sure you allow plenty of time when you return to the hotel if you have left your luggage with them. The majority of the luggage is stored in the foyer next to the concierge desk and it is not only not secure but looks ugly when you enter the hotel. We left our bag and headed out for the day when we returned it took them 30mins to find our bag as someone had taken it up the the room that we just checked out of!
reviews.title: One of the best hotel experiences ive had.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next time I'll stay at the raddisson. Its the same price but a much better hotel
reviews.title: very impressed

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on a Saturday night, so our fellow guests tended to be of a more leisurely nature, rather than the norm (this hotel is primarily a business hotel). It oozes business everywhere, from the relatively moderate sized rooms (built for 1 in comfort), high prices to charge to the corporate card ($AUD42 for breakfast), smack-bang in the middle of the CBD location and the incredibly large selection of alcohol (hotel sized of course) awaiting in each room ala mini bar (again with prices reserved for the corporate card – if corporates still allow it these days).
reviews.title: Stay at the Westin

reviews.text: We stayed in the Westin for 5 nights mid-August. We had one room with two double beds, so we could sleep with 2 young kids in one room. Location is good, very central. 5 minutes walk from Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and Hyde Park, one minute walk from Pitt St Mall and David Jones. In the heart of the CBD. Room is spacious, modern and spotless. Bathroom is beautiful, nice design, great rain shower and separate bathtub. Breakfast is good but overpriced, especially if you have very good alternatives in the lobby and around the corner. Staff was always very kind and professional. Concierge is very helpful (he helped us to get a table in Restaurant Tetsuya’s, although they were fully booked for months!). Lobby is big and always crowded. Great pizza and sushi in the lower level food court. Swimming pool is situated in the former GPO, quite a walk form the main building. Although not rather cheap, we can highly recommend this Westin.
reviews.title: Modern, deluxe, very central in Sydney

reviews.text: We had high expectation of the Westin Sydney, having had a very enjoyable stay in the Westin Melbourne a couple of months ago. Our experience wasn't up to standard.
reviews.title: Could be better

reviews.text: Firstly, the initial room we were allocated (Rm 303) was very noisy, as it overlooked the restaurants and central atrium. We were so close you could tell what the guest sitting below ordered for dinner. As we had work committments the following day, we went to reception to request a room change. The reception staff member didn't handle the request well - he informed us that the hotel would be quiet after 10.00pm (?), that no other rooms were available and that there was no way he could be expected to remember us checking in as he was a busy man (we'd checked in with him less than 10 minutes previously). Anyway, after a 15 minute wait and consultation with the manager, we were eventually moved to the 18th floor.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in the perfect location

reviews.text: A much better room, lot quieter but it hadn't been cleaned properly. There was a sticky mess, perhaps juice, on one of the bedside tables and the other had a foul smelling liquid under the radio. We used a flannel from the bathroom to clean this up. In fairness the rest of the room and the bathroom were very clean, so I'm not sure how this grottiness was overlooked.
reviews.title: The worst night ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd also say that the room decor isn't up to 5 star standard. The carpet looks like it escaped from a basic hotel chain, ditto the upolstery fabric. A long way from luxe.
reviews.title: SPG floor was excellent

reviews.text: This hotel is great, lovely room, fab bathroom, but you may want to order breakfast in bed. We had to queue for breakfast, because there were to many people. But they do have a great breakfast. Service is great, and the location is fantastic.
reviews.title: Breakfast in Bed

reviews.text: Second time to stay at this hotel and was not disappointed again.
reviews.title: Brilliant! (Again)

likes.liked: — Modern, spacious rooms with great beds
likes.disliked: — Can be a little over-priced if you don't snag a good deal on the Web

reviews.text: Check-in process was friendly and although no suites were available, the agent put me in a great Tower room on the 22nd floor with a Martin Place view (see photo).
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was superb. I just love how the bathroom looks into the bedroom and vice versa (a blind can be used if you wish). The bed seemed much more comfortable than other heavenly beds; it was wonderful.
reviews.title: Not for a honeymoon - go elesewhere

likes.liked: — Size and Quality of the Rooms
likes.disliked: — Business Hotel - 100% of the way, if you don't fit in you will be disssapointed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was clean, large, and had decent amenities. A Turn-down service replaced the towels in the evening and gave the bathroom a fresh clean.
reviews.title: One of the best in the world - no complaints for us

likes.liked: — The comfortable room and the bath tub!

reviews.text: I heartily agree with Classylad's review of the Westin Sydney - it must have been something about last week because we seem to have had pretty much the same experience.
reviews.title: Schzophrenic hotel staff

likes.disliked: — inconsistent service from some management and staff

reviews.text: On arrival last Tuesday (3June) for my 10th stay this year(at the Westin Sydney) the reception I got at check-in can only be described as a fiasco and certainly well short of what I expect from the Westin Sydney.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel. Inconsistent service. Impressive housekeeping.

reviews.text: It's odd because on my last stay here in April, my colleague and I were bowled over by the helpful, friendly staff who went out of their way to make us feel welcome.
reviews.title: Westin is just okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first room I was given was certainly not an upgrade - one of the benefits expected as a Gold SPG member within 2 stays of Platinum membership and on my 10th visit!!!! When I opened the curtains in the first room I was allocated, it faced on to the bridge across to the heritage building. Anyone walking across the bridge would look straight into my room....certainly not what I expect of a 5 star hotel nor as a very frequent, repeat guest.
reviews.title: Excellent corporate hotel with modern rooms

likes.disliked: — If you expect a romantic resort, this is not it, and that isn't what it is designed to be.

reviews.text: When working in the business centre, my colleague and I tried to order 2 cups of coffee. We called room service and were told that we could not do that. Neither of us could understand why it is possible to order a cappuccino in your room and charge it to your room but NOT possible to order a coffee to the business centre and charge it to your room??!!
reviews.title: Worst service ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed in Sydney a few times before but found the central location of the Westin one of the best. Its a few minutes walk to major depatment stores and shopping and about a 15 minute walk to the Rocks or Darling Harbour. We stayed in the old part that has been restored. The rooms were lovely, well decorated and the "heavenly beds" so comfortable. Staff was very helpful.
reviews.title: Great hotel, good location

reviews.text: Wireless internet was available free in the hallways and foyer. Breakfast was included in our room price and was good. We ate only one dinner in the dining room. The food was good, but in my opinion quite overpriced when compared to a similar meal we had at "The Rocks". I would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: Terrific hotel !

reviews.text: This was one of the better Starwood properties I have stayed in last few years. Am definitely returning back. A few highlights:
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: - Terrific location in the central business district. A quick walk to most business head quarters. And a pleasant 15 minute walk to the Rocks, harbor bridge and the opera house.
reviews.title: Oustanding overall hotel experience

reviews.text: - Lovely architecture, beautifully integrated with the colonial era post office. It’s a pleasure to wander around the lobby area and admire the colonial architecture.
reviews.title: This hotel is a Five, although I could see a strong 4

reviews.text: have stayed in most of the 5 star hotels in sydney and this was hands down the best if u like modern finishings. check the rates on wotif.com and booked direct on the westin website. had a great room on 22nd floor of the tower.
reviews.title: number one hotel in sydney- especially when booking direct

reviews.text: gym is shared and a bit of a walk through the post office 3rd floor to get to. need to bring your own towel to wipe down the equipment.
reviews.title: Big, Clean, Quiet Room - Really Good Stay

reviews.text: breakfast buffet at A$41 a bit pricey, but comparable with the going rate in sydney hotels.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel in CBD of Sydney! Walk to almost everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: definately will stay here again when next in town.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THIS. THIS was the hotel with the BEST beds.
reviews.title: Fantastic service and ambience at the Westin Hotel Sydney

reviews.text: So I ring up the day before to ask if I can get an early check in due to my early arrival which included an infant. They said "Sorry we are fully booked for tonight but we will try and get you checked in by 12pm". Big lie. I jumped on their website and there were at least 10 rooms available that evening.
reviews.title: Off to a dissapointing start but everything kept on improving.

reviews.text: Anyway, I now arrive at the hotel around 11.30am and the receptionist tells me the room is not ready and it won't be ready until around 1pm. And that was it. Despite seeing me with an infant she didn't offer to call me as soon as the room is ready but said to try again after 1pm. We tried just before 1pm and was told the room is now ready. Went up to the room but there was no crib even though we requested one along with our reservation. We rung reception and then they brought one up. And this is where our negative experienced stopped.
reviews.title: Absolute luxury, loved every detail

reviews.text: The positive begins: the room was immaculately clean. Not a scratch anywhere, everything was new. I think we were in the new tower. The view was so so but we didn't mind too much because we did not come for the view. The hotel itself is very stylish and has a myriad of restaurants, some of which are reasonably priced. Room service though is extremely expensive and they also charge a delivery fee of $8.00. The breakfast was great and can't fault it in any way.
reviews.title: Westin Comfort in Australia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was a bit dissapointing and there was paint peeled and not a chair or anything to keep your towels but nevertheless it was acceptable. No wonder they don't show on their website too many photos of the pool.
reviews.title: Great City Hotel

reviews.text: Another nice touch was the free internet access in their business centre. The staff was great and very helpful with some dietary requirements for our little one, and they heated up the meals for us. The room service lady left some extra soaps for us seeing we were travelling together as a family. Also worth mentioning is the great shower which also had a rainshower head.
reviews.title: Loved it!!!!

reviews.text: very good hotel and location. we stayed 4 nights.
reviews.title: location and comfort

reviews.text: you can walk anywhere. safe area. beautiful room, special design.
reviews.title: Stay every time I'm in Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: near by alot of locations for dining - all kinds.
reviews.title: Poor Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: you can walk anywhere.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and location

reviews.text: we walked alot. we used public transportation only twice, when we wanted to try the mono-train and when we came back after crossing the harbor bridge.
reviews.title: Great Hotel To seek refuge in

reviews.text: I booked this hotel after about a month of searching and reading reviews online and was not disappointed. I had to drop my bag off early in the morning and the porters were helpful and welcoming. The room I stayed in didn't have a great view although the clock tower is certainly pleasant in it's own way. The rooms were tastefully decorated in white and neutral tones and true to the pictures on the website.
reviews.title: Beatifully Located

reviews.text: The service at the hotel was variable, the check-in staff were abrupt but the concierge was helpful throughout my stay. Each night housekeeping staff delivered complimentary water to my room. The bed was large and comfortable and the bathroom was very well organised and large, I was able to watch tv from the bathtub through the feature glass wall which was a nice touch, although the glass wan't cleaned throughout my stay of several days. The room service menu was very expensive but there were other options within the local area for meals and a supermarket within a block. I would definetely go back as the hotel is in a superb location, centrally located to the CBD of Sydney and only a 5 minute walk from Darling Harbour and a 7-8 minute walk from Circular Quay
reviews.title: An Amazing Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had to travel to Sydney on business last week, and I chose to stay at the Westin. It was my first time staying at a Starwood property. I cannot say enough good things about my experience at the Westin Sydney. From the moment I arrived through until I checked out, everything: the service, my room, the staff - everything was top notch. My room was clean (and I am incredibly fussy about that). The bed was unbelievably comfortable. The hotel is in such a wonderful, central location. Unfortunately my room had a very ordinary view - but since I was only staying one night and was on a business trip and not vacation I didn't care about that. I was thoroughly impressed with my experience there, and will not hesitate to recommend the Westin to friends and family. The only thing I didn't like was that my stay at the Westin was so short - just overnight. Next up is a stay at the Westin Melbourne, and I hope that they are on par (if not better) than their Sydney counterpart.
reviews.title: Excellent business hotel, between shopping and harbors

reviews.text: The Westin Sydney is a very nice business hotel located in the CBD (Central Business District) of Sydney. As such, it is not in the heart of the tourist attractions on the Circular Quay or along Darling Harbor, but it is about a six block walk to either harbor, and just a couple of blocks to a number of shops. The hotel was built atop the old Sydney Post Office, and has a sunny atrium in the post office space.
reviews.title: Maintaining The Standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very nice. They feature a full wall of plate glass between the bathroom and the room, which sets them apart! (There is a power shade to cover the window.)
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who appreciates the finer things in life. The hotel is located in the heart of the CBD in Sydney and only about 10 mins walk from Central Quays Harbour and the Opera House.
reviews.title: The most comfortable beds, great location - a truly 5* hotel

reviews.text: The quality of the room was top class with all mod-cons you could want. The bed was amazing. I had the best sleep here compared to any other hotel (on par with the Royal Palm in Mauritius), and it helped with my jet lag hugely. The bathroom was amazing. A good sized walk in shower and large bath with a glass screen to the bedroom so you could see the TV and here via the bathroom speakers.
reviews.title: If in Sydney stay here, top class hotel

reviews.text: The room service was good and in-room dining good too.
reviews.title: I want to take the shower home with me.....

reviews.text: We ate in one of the hotel's many restuarants - pricey but excellent quality. The breakfast was also very expensive but the choice was huge and satisfying.
reviews.title: My favourite hotel in the world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you can afford to stay here I would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Contemporary Elegance in the heart of the CBD

reviews.text: Just spend a GREAT week at the Westin and could not have been treated better - from being able to check in when we arrived at 9:00 in the morning, to the large room with a view of the clock to the waterfall shower and huge tub - to the not charging for the extra bed for my daughter. We also enjoyed the breakfasts with all the fresh food and the useage of the Health Club and pool.
reviews.title: Loved the Wesin! Rooms, Location the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was great - right across from Starbucks (cannot seem to do without my Mocha) and the ease with getting to Darling Harbor or Circular Quay as well as Hyde Park and the shopping areas. Easy access to the monorail as well.
reviews.title: A high quality hotel, ruined by terrible customer service.

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 4 days to kick off a long holiday in Australia.
reviews.title: Great Hardware, Poor Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite the hotel being informed directly with our arrival date and time, it would have been nice of them to inform us that the Sydney marathon was running when we expected to arrive and effectively cut-off the hotel from the rest of the city. We were forced, after being abandoned by the taxi driver, to run through/across the runners in the marathon dragging our luggage behind us then walk 8 or so blocks to the hotel. Not fun after a 24hr flight. The bell boy at the hotel seemed to find this very funny. A top class hotel would have informed us of the problem beforehand and arranged some help - at least a bell-hop or taxi/shuttle on the 'inside' of the marathon to help with luggage.
reviews.title: Opulent Westin Sydney
Luxury and character
reviews.text: This terrible start was a real shame as the physical building itself is fantastic, the lobby great, the room was excellent and the bathroom very well appointed. If it wasn't for the marathon debacle and the laughing bell-boy this hotel would have got 4 stars.

I just finished a week long stay in a tower deluxe room at the Westin and was extremely pleased. The property is certainly a flagship within the Westin brand and the combination of the old General Post Office and high-rise tower provides for interesting architectural contrasts and updated standards of luxury.
reviews.title: Certainly Earns its Conde Nast Gold List Rating

reviews.text: Our room was quite large, the air conditioning strong yet quiet, the Bose music system pleasant to the ear, the lighting superb, and the bed and bath worthy of their "heavenly" moniker, especially the extremely deep soaking tub and the separate shower with both rainbath and hand showerheads.
reviews.title: Brilliant- will be back again

reviews.text: The room was virtually spot-free and the housekeeping service timely and efficient each day. Breakfast (normally $42 per person) was included in our special SPG promotional rate and was bountiful and of great quality, and the restaurant really showcases the architectural interest of the building.
reviews.title: Best hotel we've stayed at in Sydney

reviews.text: Food in Sydney tends toward the expensive side yet the quality of the meal is often unremarkable. Given that, we ate several meals at the casual restaurants in the bottom level of the hotel, even though they aren't directly affiliated with the Westin. Quite satisfactory pizzas and fishes can be had quickly for less than $20 AUD, and we found that a good option compared to food that was no better, but twice the time and money.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but there are better options

reviews.text: Because I loved so many things about the hotel, I'm giving it a top rating, but I did have a few niggles:
reviews.title: It's a Westin

reviews.text: Great business location. Neighborhood is slow on weekends, busy during the week. Not sure about the negative reviews, but service was great for us. Checked us in early and room was great. Value proposition isn't the best, but still one of the best hotels in Sydney. Walkable to the Quay and neighborhood pubs that have busy happy hours.
reviews.title: Great CBD Location

likes.liked: — Location; free gym and business center

reviews.title: Superb room - Arrogant hotel
reviews.text: Personally I prefer the Radisson Plaza!

I cannot fault the room. the very comfortable bed and the great facilities at the Westin. However, all were soured by the rudeness of the person checking me in. First they had messed up my booking but didn't apologies, secondly they told me twice about how I would be fined if I smoked - I felt that they were making assumptions based on the slightly hippy casual clothes I was wearing when I checked in that i was a smoker. I am not. Thirdly, I was disappointed when I came down later in a business suit (I was there for work) that their attitude was completely different. this alone put me off this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice except for Pool area!

likes.disliked: — The pool area....Way too shabby to be called 5 star!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The final downside was the extortionate price of room service compared to similar hotels in Sydney.
reviews.title: Westin Sydney falls short and hits average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was left with the overall impression that this hotel thinks it is better than it is. If it's possible for a hotel to be arrogant then the Westin has it.
reviews.title: Fab

reviews.text: We stayed at the Westin Sydney for 3 nights in April. From check in to check out stay was absolutely wonderful.
reviews.title: One of Sydney's best
Worth it for the breakfast
reviews.text: The hotel itself is spectacular. The front of the building is the historic General Post Office and clock tower which they have incorporated into the hotel. It is just amazing. Our deluxe room was located on the 22nd floor and was so spacious and modern. The marble bathroom was fantastic as were the amenities provided. The heavenly beds were wonderful and extremely comfortable. I haven't slept that well in a long time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The highlight of our stay was definitely the breakfast. The restaurant overlooks the historic lobby area and is just amazing. There was so much to choose from and everything was so fresh and tasty. Definitely one of the better hotel breakfasts I've had in my time.
reviews.title: Comfortable beds, great city views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have noticed from other hotel stays in Sydney that many of the staff members working in Sydney hotels (compared to Melbourne ones at least) have a slightly snobbish attitude to guests which comes off as a little pretentious. Not at the Westin. All the staff members we dealt with were friendly, courteous and were always willing to help.
reviews.title: Excellent, if not a little pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the Westin is one of my new favourite hotels in Sydney and I am looking forward to returning.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed here last week for four nights. Very comfortable stylish hotel with superb beds and fabulous staff. Breakfasts were great in the Club Lounge. We had Executive King roms in the tower block and thought they were good. Wouldn't have wanted a much smaller room. Hotel is in a great location. Can't commend the staff highly enough - all helpful, relaxed and professional.
reviews.title: Recommend The Westin
good location
reviews.text: As a tourist location, it is good. If you are looking for something closer to the opera house and ferries, try the sydney harbour marriott.
Westin had good service, helpful staff with tourist question (very knowledge) and nice rooms. will not go wrong. Seems to be more business clients. Fun times.
reviews.title: Modern, comfortable and stylish rooms, impressive buidling.

reviews.text: An impressive, modern hotel, carved out of (or in to) the Victorian General Post Office building. Check-in was efficient and no-nonsense. Room on 25th floor of the new tower was modern, clean, spacious, with a particularly bright and modern bathroom, one wall of which is entirely glass, allowing you to sit in the tub, look into the bedroom area and TV, or straight through to the buildings outside (yes, there are blinds that separate off the bathroom if you wish!). Separate, and large, walk-in shower. Small irritation – found in so many similar hotels – of tea and coffee tray stored away at almost floor-level, no nearby socket for kettle, and having set everything up on the first day, the room attendants then go and pack it all away each time, so you have to start again! Very comfortable “Heavenly” bed (the Starwood trade-mark offering) and good central lighting control (for once, the master switch really does seem to turn off all, not just most, of the lights). At the end of my stay I had my computer bag stolen in a bar on The Rocks, containing lap-top, wallet, mobile phone, etc (luckily passport, keys, etc, were in the room safe). The two young-ish duty managers handled the situation reasonably well, although one seemed more concerned about how I was going to settle my bill there and then (my Amex card had been taken) than actually helping with my own problems (eg took a lot of negotiation to get them to agree to make any cash advance at all and add it to my bill)! In the end they got an Amex authorisation by phone and provided me with a free taxi-voucher back to the airport, free calls to my company head office in New York, and had also offered to provide lunch – overall good service, after just a tiny bit of encouragement.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, well-located

reviews.text: I stayed at the Westin Sydney on a business trip, but also had a bit of time for sightseeing. My room was in the Heritage section, facing the inner courtyard, so the view was nothing to look at but it was absolutely quiet. Although this is the old section of the hotel, it has been beautifully redone and the rooms are immaculate, with modern furnishings and spacious new bathrooms (no picture window from the bath, however). The Heavenly Bed is wonderful, and there was an actual walk-in closet with tons of space and an iron & board included.
reviews.title: Stylish, warm and friendly
